name: Environmental Design
summary: Shaping physical and digital surroundings to influence behavior and support goals.
explanation: Environmental design is the practice of intentionally shaping physical and digital surroundings to influence behavior, support goals, and reduce reliance on willpower. The approach is based on: environment affects behavior more than we realize, changing environment is often easier than changing willpower, and design can make good behaviors easier and bad behaviors harder. Strategies include: visibility (making desired behaviors obvious), accessibility (making them easy), friction (adding obstacles to undesired behaviors), and cues (triggers for intended actions). Examples include: keeping healthy food visible, phone-free zones, organized workspace, and strategic placement of exercise equipment. Environmental design works because: it operates continuously (unlike willpower which fluctuates), it reduces decision load, and it makes desired behaviors path of least resistance. For knowledge workers, environmental design means: creating workspaces that support focus, designing digital environments that minimize distraction, and arranging physical spaces to cue productive behaviors.
